definition: ostrich policy (sticking one's head in the sand, failing to acknowledge danger)
bird/CL:隻|只[zhi1],群[qun2]/(dialect) to pay attention to/(intensifier) damned/goddam

policy/plan/scheme/bamboo slip for writing (old)/to whip (a horse)/to encourage/riding crop with sharp spines (old)/essay written for the imperial examinations (old)/upward horizontal stroke in calligraphy

sentences.english: President and First Lady adopts the ostrich policy, hides does not come out in the bedroom.
sentences.chinese: 總統和第一夫人採取鴕鳥政策，躲在臥室裏不出來。

sentences.english: Both manufacturing and services suffer from head-in-the-sand attitudes in the finance industry.
sentences.chinese: 製造業和服務業都慘遭金融業鴕鳥政策的毒害。

sentences.english: This ostrich policy was brought into derision.
sentences.chinese: 這種鴕鳥政策受到嘲笑。
